intro: Ptilotus obovatus var. griseus, commonly known as the grey ptilotus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, sparsely branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. This plant is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
